div.head: THE EGYPTIAN GAZETTE
No. 7,129] ALEXANDRIA, TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 21, 1905. [SIX PAGES P.T. 1.
The Eastern Telegraph Company, Limited.
div.p:
This Company's system of submarine telegraph
cables is the most direct and quickest means of
communication from Egypt to Europe, North and
South America, East, South and West Africa,
India, Australia, New Zealand, China and Japan.

To secure quick transmission, telegrams should
be marked Via Eastern.

For latest average time to London, see daily
bulletin in this paper.

STATIONS IN EGYPT: Alexandria, Cairo,
Suez, Port-Tewfik, Port-Saïd, Suakin. Head
Office. London.

div.head: Peninsular and Oriental S. N. Company.
div.p: The following steamers are intended to leave port Said on or about the following dates:
Port Said to London Via Brindisi
The Brindisi Express Steamers leave Port Said after arrival of Indian Mail. Combined steamer and sleeping car fare from Port Said to London via Brindiri or via Marseilles £25.9.11.
To the East

The Mail Steamers leave Suez for Aden and Bombay every Wednesday, and for Australia and China eery alternate Wednesday. A steamer leaves for Caloutta, fortnightly, and another for Japan. Passengers can embark at Port Said
For all further information apply to the Company's Agents,
Messrs. THOS. COOK & SON (Egypt) Ltd. CAIRO.
GEORGE ROYLE, Esq. PORT-SAID.
Messrs. HABELDEN & Co. ALEXANDRIA.
F. G. DAVIDSON, Superintendent P. & O. S. N. Company in Egypt SUEZ.

div.head: Orient-Pacific Line of Royal Mail Steamers.
div.p: OUTWARDS to AUSTRALIA.
R.M.S. "Omrah" will leave Suez about Feb 24 | R.M.S "Ophir" will leave Suez about Mar 10.
HOMEWARDS to NAPLES MARSEILLES, GIBRALTAR, PLYMOUTH, LONDON, TILBURY
R.M.S. "Oroya" will leave Port Said about Feb 27. | R.M.S. "Ormus" will leave Port Said about Mar 18.
N.B. Homeward steamers are sometimes before their advertised dates.
Passengers landed and embarked at Ismalilia, Qurantine Regulations Permitting, free of all expense.

Return tickets no longer issued, but passengers paying full fare in one direction allowed abatement of 1/3 fare back if return voyage be within 4 months of arrival, or abatement of 20 o/o if return voyage be made within 8 months of arrival.
Agents. Cairo:—Thos. Cook & Son. Alexandria : —R. J. Moss & Co.—For all information apply
Wm. STAPLEDON & Sons, PORT-SAID & PORT-TEWFIK (Suez) 31-12-904

div.head: BIBBY LINE MAIL STEAMERS.
div.p: Special Reduced Rates During Summer Season,
OUTWARDS to COLOMBO, TUTICORIN, etc., and RANGOON.
S.S. Worcestershire 7,760 tons, leaves about March 2.
S.S. Werrickshire 7,966 tons, leaves about March 16.
HOMEWARDS to MARSEILLES and LONDON.
S.S. Derbyshire 6,656 tons, leaves about February 19.
S.S. Yorkshire 4,244 tons leaves about August 9,
FARES from Port Said to Marseilles £12.0.0, London £17.0.0, Colombo £32.10.0, Rangoon £37.10.0.
Fitted with Refrigerators, Electric Light, Electric fans and all recent improvements
Experienced Stewardesses and surgeons carried. - Agents in Cairo: Messrs, THOS. COOK & SON. Suez & Port Said
For particulars apply to WM. STAPLEDON & SONS, Port Said & Port Tewfik(Suez)
Note. The outward Bibby will henceforth leave Suez one day later than before 31-12-905

div.head: KHEDIVIAL MAIL LINE.
GREECE - TURKEY LINE.
div.p: Express Steamers leave Alexandria every Wednesday at 4 p.m. for PIRAEUS, SMYRNA, MITYLENE, and CONSTANTINOPLE, in connection with Orient Express train-de-luxe for Vienna, Paris, and London.

div.head: PALESTINE - SYRIA LINE.
div.p: Fast steamers leave Alexandria every Saturday at 6 p.m., and Port Said every Sunday at 6 p.m., for JAFFA (for Jerusalem), CAIFFA (for Nazareth), BEYROUT (for Damascus), TRIPOLI, ALEXANDRETTA, MESSINA, continuing in alternate weeks to LARNACA and LIMASSOL (Cyprus).

div.head: RED SEA LINE.
div.p: Steamers leave Suez every Thursday at 6 p.m. for JEDDAH, SUAKIN, MASSOWAH, HODBIDAH, and ADEN ; and in the intervening weeks for PORT SUDAN and SUAKIN direct. Calls will be made at TOR (for Mount Sinai) as required.
N.B.—Deck chairs provided for the use of passengers, excellent cuisine and table wine free.
Steamer plans may be seen and passages booked at the Company's Agencies at Alexandria, Cairo, Port Said, and Suez, or at THOS. COOK & SON or other Tourist Agency. 31-12-904

div.head: The Moss S.S. Company, Ltd.
div.p: For LIVERPOOL calling at MALTA (Messrs. JAMES MOSS & Co. 31, James St, Liverpool, Managers.)

*Second class accommodation only, unless specially reserved.—Fares : To Liverpool, 1st, £14 Single, £25 Return. 2nd, £9 Single, £15 Return.—To Malta, 1st, £5 Single, £9 Return, 2nd, £3 Single, £5 Return.—Return tickets available for six months.
S.S. Ramses now on the berth, will sail on or aboutThursday, February 23, to be followed by S.S. Nitocris.
Through freight rates on cotton, etc., to Lancashire inland towns, Boston, New York and other U.S.A. towns, obtained on application. Cargo taken by special agreement only.
Passenger Tickets also issued inclusive of Railway fare through to and from Cairo. Particulars on application to
R. J. MOSS & Co., Alexandria, Agents. 26-12-905

div.head: P. HENDERSON & CO's LINE.
div.p: Steamers leave SUEZ and PORT SAID fortnightly for LONDON or LIVERPOOL direct.
(Electric Light.) SALOON (Amidships) FARE £12. (Latest improvements.)
S.S. IRRAWADDY 7800 Tons will leave PORT SAID about Feb 21 for Liverpool.
S.S. AMARAPOORA 6600 Tons will leave PORT SAID about March 4 for Liverpool
S.S. BURMA 6600 Tons will leave PORT SAID about March 18 fr Liverpool.
Due in LONDON or LIVERPOOL 12 days thereafter.
Apply WORMS & Co., Port Said and Suez. THOS. COOK & SON, (EGYPT) LD., CAIRO ;
G. J. GRACE & CO., ALEXANDRIA.

div.head: Thos. Cook & Son,
div.p: (EGYPT), LIMITED, HEAD OFFICE—LUDGATE CIRCUS—LONDON.
CHIEF EGYPTIAN OFFICE — CAIRO, near SHEPHEARD'S HOTEL.
Alexandria, Port-Said, Suez, Luxor, Assuan, Haifa, & Khartum.
GENERAL RAILWAY AND STEAMSHIP AGENTS. BANKERS.
BAGGAGE AND FORWARDING AGENTS.
Officially appointed & Sole Agents in Cairo to the P.&O. S.N. Co.

RESIDENTS IN EGYPT proceeding to Europe for the summer are requested to apply to our offices for information respecting their Passages, where steamer plans may be consulted and Berths secured by all Lines of Steamers to all parts of the Globe; arrangements can also be made for the collection and forwarding of their baggage and clearance at port of arrival.

CIRCULAR NOTES issued payable at the current rate of exchange in all the principal cities of Europe. Cook's Interpreters in uniform are present at the principal Railway stations and Landing-places in Europe to assist passengers holding their travelling tickets.

Large and splendidly appointed steamers belonging to the Co. leave Cairo thrice weekly, between November and March, for Luxor, Assouan and Wady-Halfa in connection with trains de luxe to Khartoum. Moderate fares.
FREIGHT SERVICE, Steamers leave Cairo every Saturday and Tuesday for Assouan and Halfa.
Special Steamers and Dahabeahs for private parties.
Special arrangements for tour in PALESTINE, SYRIA and the DESERT, Lowest Rates.
Best camp equipment in the country! 10 12-904

div.p:

HAMBURG, via ANTWERP & MALTA, to ALEXANDRIA and vice-versa, admitting

ALEXANDRIA and all chief ports of Egypt, Syria, etc., at favourable through
rates of DEUTSCHE
VERKEHR (traffic).

SS Imbroe Jan 9 from Antwerp bound for Beyrout
S.S. Lemnos Jan 17 from Hamburg bound for Beyrout.
S.S. Leroe Jan 20 from Syria bound for Rotterdam and Hamburg.

div.head: NATIONAL BANK OF EGYPT.
div.p: CAPITAL: L. 2,500,000. RESERVE (ENVIRON) : L. 862,000.
Gouverneur: Sir ELWIN PALMER, K.C.B., K.C.M.G.

Siège Social au Caire, Succursale à Alexandria, Agence à Assiout, Assuoan, Benha, Beni-Suef, Chibin el Kom, Damanhour, Fayoum, Khartoum, Kéneh, Mansourah. Minieh, Port-Said, Suakin, Sohag, Tantah, Zagazig, Mouski (Caire) et Londres (4 et 5, King William Street).

La National Bank of Egypt reçoit des dépots à termes fixes, fait des avances et ouvre des comptes courants sur titres, valeurs et marchandises. Elle s'occupe de l'achat et de la vente d'effets sur l'Etranger, de l'escompte, ainsi que de toutes opérations de Banque. 31-12-904

div.head: IMPERIAL OTTOMAN BANK.
div.p: HEAD OFFIOE IN CONSTANTINOPLE. CHIEF AGENCIES: LONDON & PARIS.
BRANCHES IN ALL THE PRINCIPAL TOWNS IN TURKEY.
Agencies in Egypt : ALEXANDRIA, CAIRO, & PORT SAID.

Advances on Merchandise and Securities in current account and for fixed periods. Purchase and sale of stocks and Shares on the London and Continental exchanges, letters of credit issued, valuables received in safe custody. Drafts, cheques and telegraphic transfers issued on the principal towns of the world. Foreign exchange purchased, bills discounted, bills, invoices, annuities and dividends collected and every description of banking business transacted. 18-4-906

div.head: NEW KHEDIVIAL HOTEL, ALEXANDRIA.
div.p: First-class Hotel. Situated in Rosetta Avenue, the finest quarter in the Town. Two mintes from Railway Station. Close to Conservatory and the Opera House. Lift. Electric Light Throughout. Perfect Sanitary Arrangements. Magnificent Ball, Reception, Reading, and Music Rooms. Bar and Smoking Room.
HENRI CHAMOULLEAU, Proprietor.
FINE TERRACE ON THE AVENUE. - SPLENDID GARDEN. - OMNIBUS MEET ALL TRAINS AND STEAMERS. 28-26

div.head: PORT SAID-SAVOY HOTEL.
div.p: NEW FIRST-CLASS HOTEL, OVERLOOKING THE HARBOUR & OPPOSITE CUSTOM HOUSE
Open all the year round. — Well-appointed Bar.
MODERATE CHARGES. SPECIAL TERMS FOR RESIDENTS 1190A2-5

div.head: HOTEL BRISTOL. CAIRO.
div.p: Full South, Electric Light, opposite Esbekieh Gardens, Large Verandahs, Moderate Charges,
CHAS. BAUER, Proprietor.

The Hotel is beautifully fitted up and is in the most central part of Cairo. Terms for pension fare at the rate of ten shillings a day. Special terms for officers of Army of Occupation. 24,882-31-10-5

div.head: SUDAN GOVERNMENT.
div.p: CAIRO-KHARTOUM SUMMER MAIL SERVICE.

Mail delivered Cairo, Tues. and Saturday morning, and Khartoum, Mon. and Friday morn. *Dining and Sleeping Cars on Egyptian Railways. If the mail is on board. Dining and sleeping cars on Sudan Railway

div.head: INTERNATIONAL SLEEPING AND RESTAURANT CARS COMPANY.

row.cell: Restaurant Car runs every day between Cairo & Alexandria & vice-versa.

div.p: By the 10.15 p.m. train between Cairo and Alexandria and vice-versa a sleeping car is attached every night. Supplement 30 P.T.

row.cell: Daily Restaurant Car Service between Cairo, Ismailia, Port Said & vice-versa.

div.p: Restaurant and Sleeping Cars on Luxor trains:
A Restaurant car and a sleeping car are attached to the 8 p.m. train from Cairo every Monday, Wednesday and Saturday and to the 5.30 p.m. train from Luxor every Tuesday, Thursday and Sunday.

Railway and Sleeping Car tickets can be obtained any number of days ahead at the office of the International Sleeping Car Company in Cairo Station. 1st class Cairo-Luxor P.T. 200. Sleeping Car supplement P.T. 75.

div.p: CAIRO-ALEXANDRIA TELEPHONE.--Rates as follows P.T. 5 for each 3 minutes, or fraction of 3 minutes; P.T. 10 for over 3 up to 8 minutes communication.

div.head: Austrian Lloyd's Steam Navigation
div.p: Alexandria-Brindisi-Venice-Trieste.

Weekly Express Mail Service. Steamers leave Alexandria every Saturday at 4 p.m. arrive at Brindisi, Tuesday a.m. in time for express to Paris, London, Naples, Rome. Arrival Trieste Wednesday noon connecting with Vienna Express (Trieste-Ostende through carriage) and expresses to Italy and Germany.
Alexandria-Patras Brindisi-Trieste-Venice Line.
Steamer leaves Alexandria on or about 1st, 15th, and 29th March
Far East Line

(Departures from Suez) To Aden, Bombay, Colombo, Penang, Singapore, Hong-Kong, Shanghai, Yokohama, Kobé about March 6 and April 4. To Aden, Karachi, and Bombay accelerated service about March 9th and 18th. To Aden, Karachi, Bombay, Colombo, Madras, Rangoon, and Calcutta about March 14th.
East African Line.
To Aden, Mombassa, Zanzibar, Beira, Delagoa Bay, Durban, about March 6th and April 3rd.
Syrian-Cyprus-Caramanian Line.
Steamers leaves Alexandria on or about February 20th, March 6th and March 20th.
For information apply to the Agents, Alexandria, Port Said and Suez, Thos. Cook & Son, Ld., Leon Heller, Cairo Agent, 4, Sharia Maghraby, (Telephone 192), Cairo; F. Tedeschi, Helouan.

div.p: Prevents the Attack of Mosquitoes
Will entirely remove all Roughness, Redness, Heat, Irritation. &c., in a very short time. It keeps the skin soft, smooth, and white at all seasons, and is delightfully cooling and refreshing.

div.head: NAPLES BERTOLINI'S PALACE HOTEL.
div.p: OPEN ALL THE YEAR ROUND-REDUCED PRICES FROM MAY TO DECEMBER-COOL, BREEZY, ELEVATED SITUATION.
Elegantly Furnished; every comfort and convenience; through connection with London; perfect climate; lovely gardens; excellent cuisine.--Wire Manager, Hotel, Khartoum.

div.head: PAGNON'S HOTELS
div.p: Cataract Hotel, Assouan.

This most popular hotel on the Upper Nile has recently been enlarged by the addition of 65 rooms and accommodates 360 guests. Grand dining hall, lift, tennis court and garden. On the southside overlooking the river. Billiard rooms and bar. Electric light throughout. Angilican Church within a few minutes of the Hotel grounds.

GRAND HOTEL, ASSOUAN.--Under the same management. Beautifully situated on river. Accommadates 90 guests. Moderate terms. Entirely rebuiltt since the fire, and fitted throughout in the most modern style. Beautiful Terrace overlooking river. Electric light throughout.

div.head: GRAND HOTEL, KHARTOUM.
div.p: Standing in a magnificent position in its own grounds on the high banks of the Blue Nile.
Elegantly Furnished; every comfort and convenience; through connection with London; perfect climate; lovely gardens; excellent cuisine.--Wire Manager, Hotel, Khartoum.

div.head: GRAND HOTEL HELOUAN
div.p: Finest and most luxurious Hotel near Cairo. Patronized by Royalty. Moderate charges.--Special terms for residents. Golf Links (18 holes) with English Professional. Own Golf House in desert.
Hotel des Bains.--Most comfortable hotel, opposite the Baths. Pension from P.T. 40.
Sulphur Bath Establishment.--Sulphur water stronger than any in Europe. Eight European Masseurs and Masseuses. Evert Modern Improvement.
George Nugovich,

div.head: DAILY WEATHER REPORT
div.p: OBSERVATIONS BY THE SURVEY DEPARTMENT.

div.head: REMARKS.
div.p: Dull and cloudy weather prevailed throughout yesterday, but towards midnight it died away to a dead calm. And gust of wind blew violently from the westward between 1 and 8 a.m. this morning. Subsequently it became calm again, and the day opens similarly. Baromeer high and rising.

table.head: OTHER STATIONS.
For the 24 hours ending 3 a.m. Yesterday

div.head: THE EGYPTIAN GAZETTE.
div.p: SUBSCRIPTIONS.—Alexandria, Cairo, and the Interior of Egypt (including delivery in Alexandria or postage to subscriber's address) P.T. 231½ per annum, P.T. 116 for six months, P.T. 80 for three months. To other countries in the Postal Union P.T. 273 (£2.16s.) per annum.

ADVERTISEMENTS.—P.T. 4 per line. Minimum charge P.T. 20. Births, Marriages, or Deaths, not exceeding three lines, P.T. 20. Every additional line P.T. 10. Notices in news column P.T. 20 per line. Contracts entered into for standing advertisements.
N.B.– Subsriptions commence from the 15th or 16th of any month.
SUBSCRIPTIONS and ADVERTISEMENTS are due in advance. P.O. Orders and Cheques to be made payable to the Editor and Manager, Rowland Snelling, Alexandria.
London Offices : 36, New Broad-street. B.C.
THE "EGYPTIAN GAZETTE" IS PRINTED ON PAPER MANUFACTURED AND SUPPLIED BY THE LONDON PAPER MILLS Co., LIMITED (SALES OFFICE: 27, CANNON STREET, E.C.)

TO THE EDITOR OF THE EGYPTIAN
Dear Sir, –My answer to the letter of the "Locataires," in your issue of to-day, is, –read paragraph in 2nd column page 3 of your

div.head: BULLETIN DE LA BOURSE
div.p: (Aujourd' hui à midi et demie)

Aujourd'hui les valeurs égyptiennes sont en baisse à Londres. La Banque Nationale, entre autres, perd 1 livre en tombant d'un seul coup de 28 1/4 à 27 1/4. La raison de cette dégringolade provient d'importants ordres de ventes transmis du Caire à Londres. On veut,parait-il, se défaire ici des titres égyptiens pour em­ployer ses capitaux en fonds d'Ètat Étrangers qui vont sûrement hausser en prévision de la paix.

Aussi toute la cote est-elle en baisse sur notre place. Pour ne citer que les principales valeurs, la Banque Nationale tombe à 27 3/16, l'Agricole à 11 1/4, la Daïra à 25 1/16, la Delta Light à 14 3/8...
On croit que le marché reprendra bientôt.

div.head: CARLTON HOTEL

Ten minutes from Alexandria. First-Class in every respect.Very moderate charges. Bulkeley is the fashionable English quarter. Visitors from Cairo alight at Sidi Gaber Station.

div.head: CALENDAR OF COMING Events
div.p: ALEXANDRIA.
February.
Tues. 21 New Masonic Hall. Albert Edward Lodge No. 707 S.C. 8:30 p.m.
Khedivial Hotel. M. Rasoul Pugno's Recital. 9.15 p.m.
Tues. 22 Zizinia Theatre. French Comedy Company in La Dame aux Camelias. 9 p.m.
Abbas Helmy Theatre. Ialian Opera Company in Mignon. 9.15 p.m.
Alhambra. Variety Entertainment and Ballet. 9.15 p.m.
Fri.24 Alderson's Garden. Variety Entertainment. 4 p.m.
New Khedivial Hotel. Recital by Fitzner Quatuor. 9 p.m.

Sat. 25 Departmental Corps, Berks. Regy. v. St. Andrew Football Club. (Return match). Moharrem Bey common. Kick-off 3 p.m. Monferrato's Hall. Reunion des Familles Society's Ball. 9.30 p.m. Cercle Mohamed Aly. Ball. 10 p.m.
CAIRO
February.
Tues. 21 Savoy Hotel. Austro-Hungarian Ball
Wed. 22 K.S.C. Third Winter Race Mooting. Masonic Hall, Boulac. Meeting Idris Lodge. 9 p.m.
Thurs. 23 Ghezireh Casino. Grand Ball.
Fri. 24 K.S.C. Third Winter Race Meeting.
Shoubra. Trials of Steam-ploughing Machines.
Zoological Gardens Performance by Ghizeh Boys' Band in afternoon. Esbekieh Garden. French Benevolent Society's Ball.
Sat. 25 Shepheard's Hotel. Band Royal Inniskilling Fusiliers. 4 to 6 p.m. Ragheb Mark Lodge No. 510. Regular meeting at 9 p.m. at Masonic Hall, Boulac.
Ragheb R. A. Mariners Lodge No. 510, immediately after closing Mark Lodge. Enthronement of W. C. N. Visitors invited. Savoy Hotel Small Dance. 10 p.m.
Tues. 28 Y.W.C.A. Rooms. Concert under the patronage of Lady Cromer.3.30 p.m.
Thurs. 30 Ghezireh Palace Hotel. Small Dance 10 p.m.
March.
Fri. 3 Khedivial Opera House. Armenian Benevolent Society's benefit performance of Siberia.
Tues. 7 Savoy Hotel Bal Poudre et Costume.
Ghezireh Casino. Bal Poudre et Costume.
Mon. 13 K.S.C. grounds. Opening of Lawn Tennis Tournament

div.head: British Chamber of Commerce
div.p: We would call the attention of persons interested in Egyptian trade to the work of the British Chamber of Commerce of Egypt, whose office in Alexandria gives information as to standings, trade, &c., to its members, and whose monthly publication reviews our commerce. The annual subscription is 1 and all British traders should become members. Our London office, 36, New Broad street E.C., acts as London agency to the Chamber.

div.head: The Best Remedy for A Heavy Cold
div.p: As soon as you feel a cold coming on begin at once with Angler's Emulsion in doses of two teaspoonfuls every two or three hours. Take no other medicine– it is not necessary. Within twenty-four hours, cough is lessened, bronchial distress and soreness are less pronounced and expectoration easier. In most cases it requires but a few days' use of Angier's Emulsion to completely cure a case of "cold." It is pleasant to take, aids digestion and builds up strength.
Angier's Emulsion
(Petroleum with Hypophosphites).
In three sizes; of Chemists and Bazaars.
Avoid imitations– all of which are made with ordinary petroleum. Be sure to get Angler's.
Angier chemical co., ld., 32 Snow Hill, London, Eng.

div.head: SALE OF MULES
div.p: Messrs. Mieli & Della Torre, Auctioneers, have been instructed to sell by Public Auction a number of Mules the property of the Army of Occupation.
The Sale will take place at Sharia Bab-el- Khalk, near the Egyptian Gouvémorat, on Friday, the 27th inst., commencing at 9 a.m.
By Order,
Arthur Colville, Colonel,
Chief Staff Officer.

div.head: Municipalité d'Alexandrie
AVIS
div.p: La Municipalité met en adjudication les tra- vaux d empierrement de la route de Siouf de- puis la station San Stefano a la rue El Ekbal.
Le cautionnement est fixé a LE. 70.
Le cahier des charges est déposé au bureau de la Voirie oh il peut être consulté par les intéressés tous les jours de 9 h.a midi,les jours fériés exceptés.
Les offres devront être adressées sous plî ca cheté a Monsieur l'Administrateur de la Muni cipalité avant le 14 Mars 1905.
Elles pourront également être déposées en séance de la Délégation le méme jour à 5h.p.m L'enveloppe devra porter, en outre la men- tion : "Sonmission ponr Empierrement de la Route de Siouf.
Le cautionnement qu le reçu d'une Banque, d'après les conditions du cahier des charges, devra être remis au Service de Comptabilité avant l'ouverture des offres et au plus tard le 14 mars à midi.
L'Administrateur, (Signé) W. P. Chataway Alexandrie, le 23 février 1905. 25484-3-3

div.head: Credit Lyonnais.
div.p: Société Anonyms Capital 250.000,000 de Francs
ENTIEREMENT VERSES
AGENCES D'EGYPTE. ALEXANDRIE- LE CAIRE— PORT-SAID
LE CREDIT LYONNAIS fais souter opérations de banque, telles que :
Avances sur titres ;
Onverture de comptes courants contre depots de valeurs ;
Emission de traites et chèques, émission le lettres de Crédit, paiement par télégraphe sur les principales villes de la France et d 'étranger ;
Garde de titres ;
Recouvrement d'effets sur l'Egypte r 'étranger.
Le Crédit Lyonnais recoit des fond* or en compte de dépôt et délivre de* bons en chésnce fixe aux taux auivants :
8% aux bons de I an en au-delà.

div.head: NOTICE TO OUR READERS
div.p: The "Egyptian Gazette" arrives in Cairo every night at 7.30 p.m and the house to house delivery of the paper to our subscribers begins at 9 p.m. All complaints as to delay in receiv- ing the "Gazette'' should be addressed to the Local Director of the Cairo Post Office. A number of complaints would be obviated if letter-boxes were put up at the main entrances of subscribers' houses.

row.cell: All shares are £1 and fully paid except where stated.

div.head: Egyptian Delta Light Railways Co., Limited.
div.p: Connections made with the most important trains of the Egyptian State Railway in the Provinces of Behera, Gharbieh, Dakahlieh Charkieh and Galioubieh.Through service for goods between all stations of the Company andover 100 principal stations of the State Railway in Upper and Lower Egypt. Goods may also be through-booked from or to any station on Helouan Railway. The Company has 70 stations opened for public Telegraph Service in conjunction with all offices of the Government Telegraph Department.For time tables, tariffs and information apply to the offices at Cairo, Alexandria Damanhour, Tantah or Zagazig. 21416 31-12.905
During Opera Season last train will leave Babel-Louk at 12.45 a.m. instead of 2.30 a.m. on Monday and Thursday nights.

div.head: Davey Paxman & Co., Ltd.
div.p: Colchester, England.
Makers of high class steam engines and boilers or British, Colonial, and Foreign Governments. Connected for ECONOMY and DURABILITY
Philadelphia Sweden Denmark Germany etc., etc.
Awarded only Gold Medal, ever given by the Royal So. of Arta and Gold Metals at the following Exhibitions:- London; Vienna 1873; Paris
Compound Portarhs Engines. Horinontan: Engines, Vertigas Engines Quick Speed Engines Engines for Electric Light
Paxman Plam & Turn Dry Bags Betters
Verticals, Langasrite & Compound Steam Engines.

Davey Paxman & Co.'s trip Geared Engine gives off a full horse power for one hour at 1 1/4 lbs. of fuel. At the great trial of COm- pound, Portable and Single Cylinder Steam Engines by the Royal Agricultural Society at Newcastle open to the whole world, Davey Paxman & Co. took the only prizes offered, establishing a record which has not yet been equalled.
